results.title: Predictors for glucose change in hypertensive participants following short-term treatment with atenolol or hydrochlorothiazide.
results.text_hl: The area under the receiver operating curve was 0.77 for @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@IFG@@@ after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and 0.71 after @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@HCTZ@@@ treatment, respectively.

citations.NLM: Moore MJ, Gong Y, Hou W, Hall K, Schmidt SO, Curry RW Jr, Beitelshees AL, Chapman A, Turner ST, Schwartz GL, Bailey K, Boerwinkle E, Gums JG, Cooper-DeHoff RM, Johnson JA. Predictors for glucose change in hypertensive participants following short-term treatment with atenolol or hydrochlorothiazide. Pharmacotherapy. 2014 Nov;34(11):1132-40. PMID: 25202885

results.title: Effects of nonselective and beta-1-selective blockade on glucose metabolism and hormone responses during insulin-induced hypoglycemia in normal man.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@Propranolol@@@ increased @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@ and @GENE_GGH @GENE_8836 @@@GH@@@ responses to @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@, whereas @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had no effect.

citations.NLM: Lauridsen UB, Christensen NJ, Lyngsøe J. Effects of nonselective and beta-1-selective blockade on glucose metabolism and hormone responses during insulin-induced hypoglycemia in normal man. J Clin Endocrinol Metab. 1983 May;56(5):876-82. PMID: 6339540

results.title: Is diabetes mellitus-linked amino acid signature associated with beta-blocker-induced impaired fasting glucose?
results.text_hl: We investigated whether this same AA signature, single-nucleotide polymorphisms in genes in their catabolic pathway, was associated with development of @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@IFG@@@) after @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment.

citations.NLM: Cooper-Dehoff RM, Hou W, Weng L, Baillie RA, Beitelshees AL, Gong Y, Shahin MH, Turner ST, Chapman A, Gums JG, Boyle SH, Zhu H, Wikoff WR, Boerwinkle E, Fiehn O, Frye RF, Kaddurah-Daouk R, Johnson JA. Is diabetes mellitus-linked amino acid signature associated with beta-blocker-induced impaired fasting glucose? Circ Cardiovasc Genet. 2014 Apr;7(2):199-205. PMID: 24627569

results.title: [Neonatal outcome after exposure to beta adrenergic blockers late in pregnancy].
results.text_hl: Our recommendation seems particularly justified with regard to @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@ which is often asymptomatic but whose consequences can be severe.

citations.NLM: Cissoko H, Jonville-Béra AP, Swortfiguer D, Giraudeau B, Autret-Leca E. [Neonatal outcome after exposure to beta adrenergic blockers late in pregnancy]. Arch Pediatr. 2005 May;12(5):543-7. PMID: 15885543

results.title: Glycemia in newborns of hypertensive mothers according to maternal treatment.
results.journal: Rev Hosp Clin Fac Med Sao Paulo
results.text_hl: There were no correlations in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group. @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@Hypoglycemia@@@ was detected in 51.3% of the @CHEMICAL_Isradipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017275 @@@isradipine@@@ group, 60% of the @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ group, and 35.7% of the control group, and it was more frequent in the first hour postpartum in all groups.

citations.NLM: Darcie S, Leone CR, Calil VM, Prescinotti EP, Kahhale S, Zugaib M. Glycemia in newborns of hypertensive mothers according to maternal treatment. Rev Hosp Clin Fac Med Sao Paulo. 2004 Oct;59(5):244-50. PMID: 15543394
citations.BibTeX: @article{15543394, title={Glycemia in newborns of hypertensive mothers according to maternal treatment.}, author={Darcie S and Leone CR and Calil VM and Prescinotti EP and Kahhale S and Zugaib M}, journal={Rev Hosp Clin Fac Med Sao Paulo}, volume={59}, number={5}, pages={244-50}}

results.title: Severe lactic acidosis complicating metformin overdose successfully treated with high-volume venovenous hemofiltration and aggressive alkalinization.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@PATIENT@@@: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was a healthy 14-yr-old female found by a sibling following a @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizure@@@ of unknown duration, thought to be secondary to @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@hypoglycemia@@@ as a consequence of a self-ingestion of @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Diclofenac @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004008 @@@diclofenac@@@.

citations.NLM: Harvey B, Hickman C, Hinson G, Ralph T, Mayer A. Severe lactic acidosis complicating metformin overdose successfully treated with high-volume venovenous hemofiltration and aggressive alkalinization. Pediatr Crit Care Med. 2005 Sep;6(5):598-601. PMID: 16148825
